question: 仕事
partsOfSpeech: noun, する verb, の adjective
sourceMnemonic: Your "<kanji>doing</kanji> <kanji>action</kanji>s" are the things you do. What do you say when someone asks "what you do"? You tell them what your <vocabulary>job</vocabulary> is.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This word uses the on'yomi reading for <ja>仕</ja> and the kun'yomi reading for <ja>事</ja>. Please note that <ja>事</ja> uses the reading <ja>こと</ja>, which you didn't learn with the kanji, but you have come across it once or twice by now, and because of the way rendaku works, it's changed to the voiced <ja>ごと</ja>.
